intro: Caesia spiralis var. latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf spiral caesia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbel-like inflorescences. The plant features slender, upright stems and broad, lance-shaped leaves that are often aromatic when crushed. Its flowers are small, white to pale pink, and arranged in a spiral pattern, giving it a unique appearance. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
